alert.note: Alert for Middle Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 09 at 1:26AM AKST until January 10 at 3:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Strong winds with blowing snow, low visibility and cold wind chills expected. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Winds gusting to 40 mph. Wind chills to 50 below. Visibility will be one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Over higher terrain north of the Chatanika River and East of Two Rivers. * WHEN...Through 3 AM Monday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wind chills as low as 50 below zero will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for blowing snow means periods of blowing snow will cause travel difficulties. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
